adjectives.description: sooky (comparative sookier or more sooky, superlative sookiest or most sooky)

entries.meaning: (Australia, Newfoundland, New Zealand, slang) Complaining, whingeing, sad; jealous.
examples: Kangaroos on the other hand become even more sooky (needy for attention), when denied time outside.

entries.meaning: (Australia, Newfoundland, New Zealand, slang) Sentimental, sissy; timid.
examples: Sentimentalists and political quacks have devoted much time to convincing the sookier twentieth century that nineteenth century New World penitentiaries were choked with near-blameless stealers of one teaspoon, one handkerchief, one loaf of bread.
